block.p: Sara Lurene Starr, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Starr of Little Falls, Minn., was married in a nondenominational ceremony on Friday to Peter Richard Weltchek, the son of Paul Weltchek of East Hampton, N.Y., and the late Edith Zanditon Weltchek. Marita Fridjhon, a minister of the Universal Life Church, officiated at the Flood Mansion in San Francisco.

The couple work in San Francisco, where the bride, 37, is a product developer for the Dockers clothing division of Levi Strauss & Company, and the bridegroom, 33, is an investment banker in the real estate group of Banc of America Securities.

Sara Lurene Starr, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Starr of Little Falls, Minn., was married in a nondenominational ceremony on Friday to Peter Richard Weltchek, the son of Paul Weltchek of East Hampton, N.Y., and the late Edith Zanditon Weltchek. Marita Fridjhon, a minister of the Universal Life Church, officiated at the Flood Mansion in San Francisco.

The couple work in San Francisco, where the bride, 37, is a product developer for the Dockers clothing division of Levi Strauss & Company, and the bridegroom, 33, is an investment banker in the real estate group of Banc of America Securities.
The bride, who is keeping her name, graduated with distinction from the University of Minnesota. Her father, a retired dentist, practiced in Little Falls.
Mr. Weltchek graduated cum laude from Colby College and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. His father retired as a partner in Shearman & Sterling, the New York law firm.
